full_text:
Trying something new hereâ€¦

ANIMATED Explosive Play Rate

Excuse the poor quality and teams disappearing at their bye week, itâ€™s something Iâ€™m trying to fix but wanted to get this out in the meantime

Giants always at the bottom ðŸ¥²

#nflverse https://t.co/HTRG2yLNc9

ANIMATED Explosive Play Rate

Explosive Pass: 20+ yard completion
Explosive Run: 10+ yard carry (incl QB runs)

Current Rankings:
Explosive Pass Rate
1. KC (11.2%)
2. PHI
3. NE

Explosive Run Rate
1. BAL (17.3%)
2. PHI
3. CLE

NYG 32nd Explosive Pass Rate since week 4

#nflverse https://t.co/9R0qK5xIRB

Defensive Explosive Play Rate Allowed

Lower left quadrant is best

Current Rankings:
Explosive Pass Rate Allowed
1. DAL (5.5%)
2. PHI
3. NO

Explosive Run Rate Allowed
1. SF (6.8%)
2. LAR
3. BAL

NYG allowed 11 explosive rushes (t-most all szn) by PHI last week

#nflverse https://t.co/ClNyCj8UE4

total qb epa when it matters (40-60 wp%) 

look at geno man #nflverse https://t.co/c7dcWZyodH

Some fans have already started rooting for a higher draft pick. The #1 pick is quite likely already decided. But what about the rest of the top 5 picks? Here are all teams whose top 5 probability is at least 1%.
#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/MDB1gnYtbp

This incredible fellow, @mrcaseb, is a constant positive influence in the open-source sports analytics community with contributions like @nflfastR and the #nflverse. His packages and data pipeline design are the blueprint for many  @sportsdataverse packages. More on his storyðŸ‘‡ https://t.co/gvoBCdJpVn

Getting back into some @nflfastR analysis. I thought the EPA/Play variability chart from 2021 was cool so I decided to look at it for the season so far. It's really impressive how consistently mediocre the Falcons offense has been this season.

#nflverse https://t.co/HKyom8natj

Day 56: Today I looked into play-by-play data available through #nflverse to come up with the top players by Red Zone volume and their TD conversion pct. Basically, how often do they convert Red Zone chances into TDs?

#100DaysOfCode #SQL

Day 57: Today I'm sharing the top 20 players by Red Zone volume and their TD efficiency. Data from #nflverse and created using #SQL. #100DaysOfCode 

First up, standings through Week 15, ordered by number of Red Zone plays (descending): https://t.co/qsbEIr7DXu

Updated after Week 15: Relative team efficiency scores, constructed using a blend of z-score standardized EPA/P and SR%

Data is from weeks 6-15, no decay. Early downs, opponent adjusted, turnovers are excluded, garbage time is excluded.

#nflverse https://t.co/O91jhyyRoZ

How good is your team at beating Vegas straight up?  

The Chiefs win 63% of their games when Vegas pregame odds are set between a 41-60% chance of winning (expectation would be around the middle of that range, so ~50%). 

NOTE: Pregame odds only! Not in-game.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/njvXuhpDM7

Simple enough. Wanted to do this anyway, for Bills and Cincinnati. Here's Actual Wins vs Vegas Odds for 2020-2022.

All of these graphics include playoffs, btw. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/rRl1AECRB9 https://t.co/7cQHTIvz1F

Alright, it's Formations Day! Here's the Chiefs offensive formations in their win over Denver. Not the best day by EPA/play for KC. 11 and 12 personnel were solid. Pop gets more run in 12 personnel than 11. Seeing Moore get snaps outside of 3 WR sets is nice. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/lGQkzaSjBW

Defensive Explosive Play Rate Allowed

Lower left quadrant is best

Current Rankings:
Explosive Pass Rate Allowed
1. DAL (5.6%)
2. NO
3. NYJ

Explosive Run Rate Allowed
1. SF (6.9%)
2. LAR
3. PIT

NYG 32nd ranked explosive run defense got worse in week 15

#nflverse https://t.co/a8TvKOCTLU

Chiefs Offensive formations vs Texans. We were good in every formation but Burton formation. Toney only took snaps in 13p, meaning he was the only WR on the field. I find it interesting that we passed the LEAST in 11p, which is generally the passing formation.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/tma1LlUXn2

Next up, Defense. Someday I'll figure out a fix for the Dunlap as LB thing. I kinda like seeing his on/off splits though (splits are incredibly noisy. Please put NO EMPHASIS WHATSOEVER ON THEM!). Chenal only in for base D. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/7nzf1oHqQ7

Houstons charts. They were effective in 11p, but with only 3 WR's dressed, didn't stick with it. EPA/play does include penalties, btw. On defense, their five snaps in 3-3-5 were really good. Everything else was bad though. 

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/19GnjiKYez

Chiefs Offensive formations vs Texans. We were good in every formation but Burton formation. Toney only took snaps in 13p, meaning he was the only WR on the field. I find it interesting that we passed the LEAST in 11p, which is generally the passing formation.

Houstons charts. They were effective in 11p, but with only 3 WR's dressed, didn't stick with it. EPA/play does include penalties, btw. On defense, their five snaps in 3-3-5 were really good. Everything else was bad though.

Day 56: Today I looked into play-by-play data available through #nflverse to come up with the top players by Red Zone volume and their TD conversion pct. Basically, how often do they convert Red Zone chances into TDs?

#100DaysOfCode #SQL

Day 57: Today I'm sharing the top 20 players by Red Zone volume and their TD efficiency. Data from #nflverse and created using #SQL. #100DaysOfCode 

First up, standings through Week 15, ordered by number of Red Zone plays (descending): https://t.co/qsbEIr7DXu

Updated after Week 15: Relative team efficiency scores, constructed using a blend of z-score standardized EPA/P and SR%

Data is from weeks 6-15, no decay. Early downs, opponent adjusted, turnovers are excluded, garbage time is excluded.

#nflverse https://t.co/O91jhyyRoZ

How good is your team at beating Vegas straight up?  

The Chiefs win 63% of their games when Vegas pregame odds are set between a 41-60% chance of winning (expectation would be around the middle of that range, so ~50%). 

NOTE: Pregame odds only! Not in-game.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/njvXuhpDM7

Simple enough. Wanted to do this anyway, for Bills and Cincinnati. Here's Actual Wins vs Vegas Odds for 2020-2022.

All of these graphics include playoffs, btw.

Alright, it's Formations Day! Here's the Chiefs offensive formations in their win over Denver. Not the best day by EPA/play for KC. 11 and 12 personnel were solid. Pop gets more run in 12 personnel than 11. Seeing Moore get snaps outside of 3 WR sets is nice.

Chiefs Offensive formations vs Texans. We were good in every formation but Burton formation. Toney only took snaps in 13p, meaning he was the only WR on the field. I find it interesting that we passed the LEAST in 11p, which is generally the passing formation.

#nflverse #rstats https://t.co/tma1LlUXn2

Next up, Defense. Someday I'll figure out a fix for the Dunlap as LB thing. I kinda like seeing his on/off splits though (splits are incredibly noisy. Please put NO EMPHASIS WHATSOEVER ON THEM!). Chenal only in for base D.

Houstons charts. They were effective in 11p, but with only 3 WR's dressed, didn't stick with it. EPA/play does include penalties, btw. On defense, their five snaps in 3-3-5 were really good. Everything else was bad though.
